course.subject: FINA
course.name: Banking and Risk Management
course.description: Banks are exposed to several types of risks from their operations: credit risk, market risk, and operational risks. This course provides an introduction to banking regulation and measuring and managing risks faced by banks. The course covers (1) current topics in banking regulation, (2) credit risk: credit ratings, rating agencies, rating methodology, credit risk modelling, and hedging with credit default swaps, (3) market risk: Value-at-Risk methodology, stress testing and scenario analysis, (4) operational risk. The course uses simulations and numerical procedures in Excel (e.g. to estimate Value-at-Risk or default probabilities).
course.prerequisites: FINA 3103 OR FINA 3103H
